mdRecord.dcterms:title: Ralph Nader at teach-in
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Hurelbrinck, Nancy
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Ralph Nader, consumer advocate, at Workers' Rights are Civil Rights: a Teach-in on the labor Movement. The program included AFL-CIO secretary-treasurer Richard Trumka; feminist social critic and author Barbara Ehrenreich; Ed Ayers and Julian Bond, History Department; Joyce Breeden, diploma coordinator; Pam Karlan, Law; and UNC-Chapel Hill Housekeepers Association chair Barbara Prear.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Visual History Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: University of Virginia
University of Virginia. News Office--Press coverage
